properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms may affect western Lake Ontario and Lake Simcoe this afternoon into this evening and could produce squalls up to 40 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-06T03:10:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T18:20:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2828469129.2020
Area: Western Lake Ontario
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Village Of Ceylon.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Ceylon. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water the Village of Cyelon water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-06-11T13:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-06-04T15:27:08-06:00, A730F54A-C29F-0010-6501-DD1B5C8F6101
Area: The Village of Ceylon.
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant Rainfall for Northeastern BC This Weekend. A series of disturbances will move through northern BC bringing periods of moderate to heavy rainfall tonight through Monday. Potential impacts for this event include rising rivers and destabilizing slopes. An already moist air mass will be enhanced by upslope flow, particularly on the east slopes of the Northern Rockies. The communities of Liard River, Muncho Lake, Toad River, Nelson Forks, Sikanni Chief and their surrounding higher terrain may see up to 50 to 80 mm of total rainfall. These areas have experienced moderate rainfall events over the past few weeks thus the ground is quite saturated in some places. Stay tuned to your local weather forecast and alerts: www.weather.gc.ca Flood Warnings and Advisories can be viewed at: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm Road Conditions: https://drivebc.ca/ ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T09:34:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T17:35:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2321187353.2020
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River, Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Slowing moving thunderstorms giving heavy rain this afternoon. A southwest to northeast line of slow moving thunderstorms is affecting portions of the Greater Toronto Area this afternoon. Local rainfall amounts of up to 50 mm are possible by 5PM. Locations impacted include: Mississauga, Downtown Toronto and Etobicoke. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T00:53:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T19:04:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3005767291.2020
Area: City of Toronto, Mississauga - Brampton
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:19 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing up to nickel size hail. This cluster of severe thunderstorms is located 14 kilometres southwest of Eagle Mountain, moving east at 40 km/h. Locations impacted include: Dorion and Eagle Mountain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-05T21:18:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T18:20:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2901878675.2020
Area: Cloud Bay - Dorion, Nipigon - Rossport
properties.Author: Environment Canada
